Class ChessServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • ChessServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class ChessServer
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Creates a chess game server
    Author:
    Zach Swanson, Deitel & Associates, Inc. and Pearson Education, Inc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String[] board
      Array of strings containing the pieces at all locations on the board in the format "(piece color)(piece type)" ie "WK" is white king
      private static java.lang.String[] COLORS
      Array of colors at PLAYER_ value index
      private int currentPlayer
      Tracks which player's move it is
      private static java.lang.String EMPTY_PIECE
      String representation of the piece value of a space with no piece on it

      Array containing various special case flag variables
      private java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock gameLock
      Lock used to enforce player turns
      private boolean[] inCheck
      Array of booleans storing whether each player is currently in check
      private java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition otherPlayerConnected
      Lock condition for other player connecting
      private java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition otherPlayerTurn
      Lock condition used when trading turns
      private javax.swing.JTextArea outputArea
      Text area used to output each attempted move sent to the server
      private static int PLAYER_B
      constant player value for second (black) player
      private static int PLAYER_W
      constant player value for first (white) player
      private ChessServer.Player[] players
      Array containing Player objects representing each player
      private java.lang.String[] previousBoard
      Array of strings containing the game state before this turn.
      private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService runGame
      ExecutorService that handles threads of both players
      private java.net.ServerSocket server
      server socket to connect with clients
      private static java.lang.String[] startingOrder
      Array containing starting order of back row pieces
      private int[] tempFlags
      Array containing temporary values of flags in case move is reverted

    • Field Detail

      • board

        private java.lang.String[] board
        Array of strings containing the pieces at all locations on the board in the format "(piece color)(piece type)" ie "WK" is white king

      • previousBoard

        private java.lang.String[] previousBoard
        Array of strings containing the game state before this turn. Used to make sure the player moves out of check if they were threatened

      • outputArea

        private javax.swing.JTextArea outputArea
        Text area used to output each attempted move sent to the server

      • players

        private ChessServer.Player[] players
        Array containing Player objects representing each player

      • server

        private java.net.ServerSocket server
        server socket to connect with clients

      • currentPlayer

        private int currentPlayer
        Tracks which player's move it is

        private static final int PLAYER_W
        constant player value for first (white) player

        private static final int PLAYER_B
        constant player value for second (black) player
        See Also:

        private static final java.lang.String[] COLORS
        Array of colors at PLAYER_ value index

        private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService runGame
        ExecutorService that handles threads of both players

        Lock used to enforce player turns

        Array containing various special case flag variables

        private int[] tempFlags
        Array containing temporary values of flags in case move is reverted

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Initializes both player connections before proceeding

      • displayMessage

        private void displayMessage(java.lang.String messageToDisplay)
        Passes asynchronous thread to AWT event dispatching thread that displays given message in server log window
        Parameters:
        messageToDisplay - message to display

      • validateAndMove

        public int validateAndMove(int fromLocation,
                  int toLocation,
                  int player)
        Determines if move is valid, and if so, implements move. Also handles enforcement of Player turns
        Parameters:
        fromLocation - starting location of piece
        toLocation - location piece is attempting to move to
        player - number of player attempting move
        Returns:
        type of move, 0 if invalid

      • pathClear

        public boolean pathClear(int fromLoc,
                int toLoc)
        Determines if path between two given locations is unblocked
        Parameters:
        fromLoc - first location
        toLoc - second location
        Returns:
        true if unblocked (possible), false if blocked

      • isThreatened

        public boolean isThreatened(int loc,
                   int player)
        Determines if the given location is threatened by any opposing pieces
        Parameters:
        loc - location to test
        player - player potentially being threatened
        Returns:
        true if space is threatened, false otherwise

      • isActuallyValidMove

        public int isActuallyValidMove(int fromLoc,
                      int toLoc,
                      java.lang.String piece)
        Determines if a move is actually valid, once it is determined that it is a valid move type for the given piece
        Parameters:
        fromLoc - starting location of piece
        toLoc - final location
        piece - piece string
        Returns:
        move type, 0=invalid, 1=true, 2=en passant, 3=castle, 4-7=pawn upgrade

      • isValidMoveStyle

        public boolean isValidMoveStyle(int fromLoc,
                       int toLoc,
                       java.lang.String piece)
        Determines if move is possible for given piece type
        Parameters:
        fromLoc - starting location of piece
        toLoc - attempted move location
        piece - value of piece
        Returns:
        true if possible, false otherwise

      • isOccupied

        public boolean isOccupied(int location)
        Determines if given location has a piece on it
        Parameters:
        location - location to check
        Returns:
        true if occupied, false if not

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Unimplemented method. If there is a checkmate, the losing player will not be able to make any valid moves and therefore the game will stop, but winner is not calculated or announced
        Returns:
        always false
